intro: Tarenna pavettoides, commonly known as the Madagascar velvetleaf, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub native to Madagascar, characterized by its dense, velvety foliage. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and prominent veins. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four petals. Tarenna pavettoides is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
